hub.title: Legal Documents
hub.description: Access all legal documents for BitCall LTD including our Terms of Service, Acceptable Use Policy, Privacy Policy, and Vendor Agreement.

aup.title: Acceptable Use Policy
aup.purpose: Our mission is to provide reliable telecommunications solutions in a secure, lawful, and respectful manner. By using our Services, you agree to comply with this AUP.
aup.enforcement: We reserve the right to investigate violations...
aup.liability: You are liable for any prohibited activities...
aup.changes: We may modify this AUP from time to time...

violateLaws.title: Violate Laws
violateLaws.content: Send or facilitate any communication that violates local, national, or international laws.

spam.title: Spam / Unsolicited Communications
spam.content: Engage in mass spam, robocalling, or any unsolicited marketing without recipients’ consent.

fraud.title: Fraud / Misrepresentation
fraud.content: Engage in scams, phishing, identity theft, or any deceptive activity (e.g., CLI spoofing for fraudulent gain).

networkAbuse.title: Network Abuse
networkAbuse.content: Attempt to gain unauthorized access to any system, disrupt network services, or transmit harmful code or software viruses.

offensiveContent.title: Offensive Content
offensiveContent.content: Transmit hateful, threatening, or otherwise objectionable content that may incite violence or discrimination.

security.title: Security
security.content: Maintain secure passwords and authentication methods to prevent unauthorized use.

monitoring.title: Monitoring & Reporting
monitoring.content: Immediately notify BitCall of any suspicious or prohibited use of your account.

compliance.title: Compliance with Terms
compliance.content: Use the Services according to our Terms of Service.

vendor.title: Vendor-Specific Obligations
vendor.content: Vendors must ensure routes comply with relevant telecom regulations and not enable illegal traffic.

terms.title: Terms of Service

introduction.registeredOffice: 124 City Road, London, United Kingdom, EC1V 2NX
introduction.description: By accessing or using the services provided by BitCall LTD ("BitCall," "we," "us," or "our"), you ("User," "Client," or "you") agree to these Terms of Service ("Terms"). If you do not agree, you must stop using our Services immediately.

scopeOfServices.title: VoIP & Telecom Offerings
scopeOfServices.content: BitCall provides voice-over-IP (VoIP) routes (standard and alternative), DID numbers, SIP trunking, and related telecommunications solutions.

scopeOfServices.title: Account Creation
scopeOfServices.content: You are required to create an account and confirm acceptance of these Terms. You must keep your login details secure and up-to-date.

scopeOfServices.title: Service Availability
scopeOfServices.content: While we strive to keep our systems online, we cannot guarantee uninterrupted access.

userResponsibilities.title: Legal Compliance
userResponsibilities.content: You agree to comply with all relevant laws and regulations when using the Services.

userResponsibilities.title: Acceptable Use
userResponsibilities.content: You agree to adhere to our Acceptable Use Policy.

userResponsibilities.title: Account Security
userResponsibilities.content: You are responsible for safeguarding your credentials; any activity under your account is your responsibility.

userResponsibilities.title: No Call Recording
userResponsibilities.content: BitCall does not record or listen to call audio. We keep only minimal metadata necessary for billing (see Privacy Policy).

paymentAndBilling.title: Prepaid Model
paymentAndBilling.content: Services are typically offered on a prepaid basis. You must maintain sufficient balance.

paymentAndBilling.title: Invoices & Charges
paymentAndBilling.content: Accurate billing is dependent on call detail records (CDRs). You agree to review invoices promptly and raise disputes within the period stated in your account or invoice.

paymentAndBilling.title: No Refund Policy
paymentAndBilling.content: Except where required by UK law, no refunds are provided once credit is used.

dataStorageRetention.cdrs: We store call detail records for a limited time (e.g., 30 days) for billing and dispute resolution. They do not include call audio content.
dataStorageRetention.deletion: After the specified retention period, CDRs are automatically deleted unless required by law.

terms.intellectualProperty: BitCall retains all rights, title, and interest in and to any software, branding, trademarks, and other IP used or provided as part of the Services.
terms.disclaimerOfWarranties: The Services are provided “as is” and “as available” without any warranties of any kind, unless explicitly stated by UK law.

limitationOfLiability.content: To the fullest extent permitted by law, BitCall shall not be liable for any indirect, consequential, or special damages, including loss of revenue or data.
limitationOfLiability.cap: Our total liability for any claim shall not exceed the amount you paid BitCall in the three months preceding the event.

terms.indemnification: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless BitCall LTD, its officers, employees, and affiliates from any claim arising from your misuse of the Services, violation of these Terms, or breach of any law.

termination.byUser: You may close your account at any time by contacting support.
termination.byUs: We may suspend or terminate your account if we determine a breach of these Terms or any suspicious activity.
termination.effects: No refunds for unused credits, unless otherwise required by law.

governingLaw.content: These Terms are governed by the laws of England and Wales.
governingLaw.disputeResolution: Any dispute shall be resolved in the courts of England and Wales.

terms.changesToTerms: We reserve the right to update or modify these Terms at any time. Continued use of the Services after changes means you accept the revised Terms.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy

details: Covers personal data collected through our website, dashboard, APIs, and telecommunications services.
Does not cover third-party websites or services linked from our platform.

dataWeCollect.accountInformation: Name, email address, billing details, and login credentials when you sign up.
dataWeCollect.usageData: Call detail records (CDRs) including caller number, called number, duration, timestamps, and cost.
dataWeCollect.technicalData: IP addresses, device identifiers, and analytics data for security and troubleshooting.

howWeUseData.serviceProvision: To provide VoIP and telecom services (billing, routing, support, etc.).
howWeUseData.accountManagement: Authentication, security alerts, and user preferences.
howWeUseData.legalCompliance: To comply with UK laws, regulations, or valid legal requests.

retentionDeletion.cdrRetention: CDRs are retained for [30 days] (or required by law) for billing and dispute resolution. After that, they are deleted.
retentionDeletion.noCallAudio: We do not record or store the audio content of calls.
retentionDeletion.accountDeletion: If you close your account, we will securely delete or anonymize your personal data, except where legally required to retain it.

sharingData.serviceProviders: We may share data with trusted partners for billing or technical support, bound by confidentiality obligations.
sharingData.legalRequirements: We may disclose data if required by law, court order, or to protect our rights or safety.

privacy.cookiesTracking: We use cookies or similar technologies to improve user experience and analyze traffic. You can control cookies via browser settings.
privacy.dataSecurity: We implement reasonable security measures (e.g., encryption, access controls) but cannot guarantee absolute security against breaches.
privacy.yourRights: Subject to UK GDPR, you have the right to access, correct, or request deletion of your personal data. Contact us to exercise these rights.
privacy.updates: We may update this Privacy Policy. Notice of significant changes will be provided. Continued use of our Services following updates means you accept the revised policy.

vendor.title: Vendor Agreement
scope.details: Covers personal data collected through our website, dashboard, APIs, and telecommunications services.
Does not cover third-party websites or services linked from our platform.

relationship.independentContractors: Nothing in this Agreement creates an agency, partnership, or joint venture.
relationship.legalCompliance: Vendors must comply with all applicable laws and regulations for telecommunications services provided to BitCall.

provisionOfServices.routeCompliance: All routes you supply must comply with relevant telecom regulations, including local and international laws.
provisionOfServices.greyRoutes: If you offer alternative/grey routes, it is your responsibility to ensure these do not facilitate illegal activities and adhere to any applicable local laws.

warrantiesRepresentations.authority: You represent that you have the right to provide the routes, and that their use by BitCall does not infringe third-party rights.
warrantiesRepresentations.quality: You warrant that you will maintain route stability, call quality, and uptime as reasonably required.

vendor.indemnification: You agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless BitCall from all claims, damages, or liabilities arising out of your routes’ misuse, non-compliance with laws, or breaches of this Agreement.

dataConfidentiality.businessData: You shall keep confidential any data or information provided by BitCall regarding usage, prices, or volumes.
dataConfidentiality.userData: You must handle any personal data in compliance with applicable privacy laws, including UK GDPR where relevant.

feesPayment.pricing: Agreed upon in writing or via separate contract.
feesPayment.paymentTerms: BitCall will pay within the agreed timeframe upon receiving valid invoices.
feesPayment.disputeResolution: Discrepancies in usage or billing should be raised promptly in writing.

termTermination.term: This Agreement remains in force until terminated by either party.
termTermination.termination: Either party may terminate for convenience with notice or immediately for breach.
termTermination.effect: Vendor must cease provision of routes, and BitCall will settle outstanding invoices in due course.

limitationOfLiability.content: Neither party shall be liable for indirect or consequential damages.
limitationOfLiability.cap: Total liability, if any, shall not exceed the amount paid by BitCall to Vendor in the preceding three months.

governingLaw.content: This Agreement is governed by the laws of England and Wales.
governingLaw.disputes: Disputes shall be settled in the courts of England and Wales.
